section-starting-page.title: TeamCity Cloud Documentation Home
section-starting-page.description: Welcome to the documentation for TeamCity 2024.07 â€” a CI/CD solution for all sorts of workflows and development practices.

a.description: Learn the basics of TeamCity features and capabilities and run your first build.
Find out how (and if?) TeamCity builds are different from jobs and explore the main TeamCity concepts.
Read about the principles of continuous integration and delivery.
Learn how the TeamCity Cloud subscription model works.
Explore a wide range of software supported by TeamCity.
If you use Maven, Gradle, .NET, or Python, explore basic CI/CD tutorials on our website. Guidelines for many other tech stacks can be found in this documentation.
Learn what are the most powerful features of TeamCity and why it can be used in any area, for a product of any scale.
See the recently introduced features.
Learn about our plans for the future releases.
Follow our blog to get the freshest updates and tutorials.
Use Kotlin DSL to define TeamCity settings programmatically.

group.title: Administer TeamCity

a.description: Learn how you can spend build credits, add more agents, and view the statistics of committers.
To integrate TeamCity with your source repositories and configure pipelines, read how to create and work with projects and build configurations.

group.a: Work with Projects and Build Configurations

a.description: See how to manage who can access your server and what actions they can perform.
Explore the detailed reports that TeamCity provide for your builds.
Be notified about build statuses via email, Slack, or browser.
Learn how to assign a responsible investigator to resolve a build or test failure, or mute a problem until it is fixed.

link-collection.title: Extend TeamCity

a.description: Use service messages to pass parameters from your scripts to TeamCity and vice versa.

link-collection.a: Set up build scripts interaction with TeamCity

a.description: Use our API to get remote control over your TeamCity instance.
The place to go when you haven't found an answer elsewhere.
See the current existing problems of TeamCity and how to work around them.
See various instructions on how to find the cause of your problem.
These problems might not be connected to TeamCity, but we still want to help.
General recommendations on contacting us.
Report a problem here.
Contact us for a feedback or advice.
